definitions: a charge or claim that someone has done something undesirable; an accusation

examples.text: there are grounds for inquiring into the imputations of misconduct against him

definitions: the action or process of ascribing righteousness, guilt, etc. to someone by virtue of a similar quality in another

examples.text: the writings of the apostles tell us that imputation of the righteousness of Christ is given to us if we receive Christ

shortDefinitions: action of ascribing righteousness to someone by virtue of similar quality in another

definitions: the assignment of a value to something by inference from the value of the products or processes to which it contributes

examples.text: the imputation of interest will increase her taxable income

shortDefinitions: assignment of value to something by inference
